intro: Prangos eriantha, commonly known as the silverleaf phlox, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is known for its adaptability to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Prangos eriantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance in gardens.
